# nipnTK: National Information Platforms for Nutrition (NiPN) Data Quality Toolkit

[National Information Platforms for Nutrition
(NiPN)](https://www.nipn-nutrition-platforms.org) is an initiative of
the European Commission to provide support to countries to strengthen
their information systems for nutrition and to improve the analysis of
data so as to better inform the strategic decisions they are faced with
to prevent malnutrition and its consequences.

As part of this mandate,
[NiPN](https://www.nipn-nutrition-platforms.org) has commissioned work
on the development of a toolkit to assess the quality of various
nutrition-specific and nutrition-related data. This is a companion R
package to the toolkit of practical analytical methods that can be
applied to variables in datasets to assess their quality.

The focus of the toolkit is on data required to assess anthropometric
status such as measurements of weight, height or length, MUAC, sex and
age. The focus is on anthropometric status but many of presented methods
could be applied to other types of data.
[NiPN](https://www.nipn-nutrition-platforms.org) may commission
additional toolkits to examine other variables or other types of
variables.

## Installation

You can install [nipnTK](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/) from
[CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org):

``` r
install.packages("nipnTK")
```

## Usage

Data quality is assessed by:

1.  Range checks and value checks to identify *univariate* outliers -
    [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/rl.html)

2.  Scatterplots and statistical methods to identify *bivariate*
    outliers - [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/sp.html)

3.  Use of flags to identify outliers in anthropometric indices -
    [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/flagging.html)

4.  Examining the distribution and the statistics of the distribution of
    measurements and anthropometric indices -
    [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/ad.html)

5.  Assessing the extent of digit preference in recorded measurements -
    [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/dp.html)

6.  Assessing the extent of age heaping in recorded ages -
    [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/ah.html)

7.  Examining the sex ratio -
    [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/sr.html)

8.  Examining age distributions and age by sex distributions -
    [guide](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/as.html)

These activities and a proposed order in which they should be performed
are shown below:

![](reference/figures/nipnWorkflow.png)

## Citation

If you use the [nipnTK](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/) package in your
work, please cite using the suggested citation provided by a call to the
`citation` function as follows:

``` r
citation("nipnTK")
#> To cite nipnTK in publications use:
#> 
#>   Mark Myatt, Ernest Guevarra (2026). _nipnTK: National Information
#>   Platforms for Nutrition (NiPN) Data Quality Toolkit_.
#>   doi:10.5281/zenodo.4297897 <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4297897>,
#>   R package version 0.2.2, <https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/>.
#> 
#> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is
#> 
#>   @Manual{,
#>     title = {nipnTK: National Information Platforms for Nutrition (NiPN) Data Quality Toolkit},
#>     author = {{Mark Myatt} and {Ernest Guevarra}},
#>     year = {2026},
#>     note = {R package version 0.2.2},
#>     url = {https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/},
#>     doi = {10.5281/zenodo.4297897},
#>   }
```

## Community guidelines

Feedback, bug reports and feature requests are welcome; file issues or
seek support [here](https://github.com/nutriverse/nipnTK/issues). If you
would like to contribute to the package, please see our [contributing
guidelines](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/CONTRIBUTING.html).

This project is released with a [Contributor Code of
Conduct](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.html). By
participating in this project you agree to abide by its terms.

 

[![This is part of the nutriverse project under the Oxford iHealth
initiative of the MSc in International Health and Tropical Medicine,
Nuffield Department of Medicine, University of
Oxford](https://github.com/nutriverse/nutriverse-images/blob/main/nutriverse/nutriverse_footer.png?raw=true)](https://nutriverse.io)

# Package index

## Description

- [`nipnTK-package`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/nipnTK.md)
  [`nipnTK`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/nipnTK.md) : NiPN
  data quality toolkit

## Checking ranges and legal values

- [`outliersUV()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/outliersUV.md)
  : IQR to detect univariate outliers
- [`rl.ex01`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/rl.ex01.md) :
  Example dataset for checking ranges and legal values

## Using scatter plots to identify outliers

- [`outliersMD()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/outliersMD.md)
  : Mahalanobis distance to detect bivariate outliers
- [`sp.ex01`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/sp.ex01.md) :
  Example dataset for using scatterplots to identify outliers
- [`sp.ex02`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/sp.ex02.md) :
  Example dataset for using scatterplots to identify outliers

## Identifying outliers using flags

- [`national.SMART()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/national.SMART.md)
  : Add SMART flags to a stratified sample survey (e.g. MICS, DHS,
  national SMART)
- [`flag.ex01`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/flag.ex01.md) :
  Example dataset for identifying outliers using flags
- [`flag.ex02`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/flag.ex02.md) :
  Example dataset for identifying outliers using flags
- [`flag.ex03`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/flag.ex03.md) :
  Example dataset for identifying outliers using flags

## Distribution of variable and indices

- [`histNormal()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/histNormal.md)
  : Histogram with normal curve superimposed to help with “by-eye”
  assessments of normality of distribution

- [`qqNormalPlot()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/qqNormalPlot.md)
  : Normal quantile-quantile plot

- [`skewKurt()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/skewKurt.md) :
  Skew and kurtosis

- [`print(`*`<skewKurt>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.skewKurt.md)
  :

  [`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html) helper function for
  [`skewKurt()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/skewKurt.md)
  function

- [`dist.ex01`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/dist.ex01.md) :
  Example dataset for distributions of variables and indices

## Digit preference

- [`fullTable()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/fullTable.md) :
  Fill out a one-dimensional table to include a specified range of
  values

- [`digitPreference()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/digitPreference.md)
  : Digit preference test

- [`plot(`*`<digitPreference>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/plot.digitPreference.md)
  :

  [`plot()`](https://rdrr.io/r/graphics/plot.default.html) helper
  function for
  [`digitPreference()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/digitPreference.md)
  function

- [`print(`*`<digitPreference>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.digitPreference.md)
  :

  [`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html) helper function for
  [`digitPreference()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/digitPreference.md)
  function

- [`dp.ex01`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/dp.ex01.md) :
  Example dataset for digit preference function

## Age heaping

- [`ageHeaping()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageHeaping.md)
  : Age-heaping analysis

- [`plot(`*`<ageHeaping>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/plot.ageHeaping.md)
  :

  [`plot()`](https://rdrr.io/r/graphics/plot.default.html) helper
  functions for
  [`ageHeaping()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageHeaping.md)
  functions

- [`print(`*`<ageHeaping>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.ageHeaping.md)
  :

  [`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html) helper functions for
  [`ageHeaping()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageHeaping.md)
  functions

- [`dp.ex02`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/dp.ex02.md) :
  Example dataset for digit preference function

- [`ah.ex01`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ah.ex01.md) :
  Example dataset for age heaping function

## Sex ratio

- [`sexRatioTest()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/sexRatioTest.md)
  : Sex Ratio Test

- [`print(`*`<sexRatioTest>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.sexRatioTest.md)
  :

  [`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html) helper function for
  [`sexRatioTest()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/sexRatioTest.md)
  function

- [`dp.ex02`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/dp.ex02.md) :
  Example dataset for digit preference function

## Age and sex distributions

- [`ageChildren()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageChildren.md)
  : Goodness of fit to an expected model-based age distribution

- [`plot(`*`<ageChildren>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/plot.ageChildren.md)
  :

  Plot helper function for
  [`ageChildren()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageChildren.md)
  function

- [`print(`*`<ageChildren>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.ageChildren.md)
  :

  [`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html) helper function for
  [`ageChildren()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageChildren.md)
  function

- [`ageRatioTest()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageRatioTest.md)
  : Age ratio test

- [`print(`*`<ageRatioTest>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.ageRatioTest.md)
  :

  [`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html) helper function for
  [`ageRatioTest()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/ageRatioTest.md)
  function

- [`sexRatioTest()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/sexRatioTest.md)
  : Sex Ratio Test

- [`pyramid.plot()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/pyramid.plot.md)
  : Pyramid plot function for creating population pyramids.

- [`as.ex01`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/as.ex01.md) :
  Example dataset for age and sex distributions function

- [`as.ex02`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/as.ex02.md) :
  Example dataset for age and sex distributions function

- [`dp.ex02`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/dp.ex02.md) :
  Example dataset for digit preference function

- [`dp.ex03`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/dp.ex03.md) :
  Example dataset for digit preference

## Utility

- [`boxText()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/boxText.md) :
  Plot text in a coloured bounding box.

- [`greensIndex()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/greensIndex.md)
  : Green's Index of Dispersion

- [`print(`*`<greensIndex>`*`)`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.greensIndex.md)
  :

  [`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html) helper function for
  [`print.greensIndex()`](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/reference/print.greensIndex.md)
  function

### All vignettes

- [Distributions of variables and
  indices](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/ad.md):
- [Age heaping](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/ah.md):
- [Age and sex
  distributions](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/as.md):
- [Digit preference](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/dp.md):
- [Identifying outliers using
  flags](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/flagging.md):
- [The NiPN data quality
  toolkit](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/nipnTK.md):
- [Checking ranges and legal
  values](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/rl.md):
- [Using scatterplots to identify
  outliers](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/sp.md):
- [Sex ratio](https://nutriverse.io/nipnTK/articles/sr.md):
